org.knime.base.data.filter.column

Class FilterColumnRowInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.node.streamable.PortInput
      • org.knime.core.node.streamable.RowInput
        • org.knime.base.data.filter.column.FilterColumnRowInput

  • public final class FilterColumnRowInput
extends RowInput
    A RowInput that wraps another input and hides/re-orders columns according to an int[].
    Since:
    2.12
    Author:
    Bernd Wiswedel, KNIME.com, Zurich, Switzerland

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FilterColumnRowInput(RowInput input, int... includes)
      New input only containing the columns as per array argument.
      FilterColumnRowInput(RowInput input, String... includes)
      New input only containing the columns as per array argument.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilterColumnRowInput

        public FilterColumnRowInput(RowInput input,
                            int... includes)
        New input only containing the columns as per array argument.
        Parameters:
        input - The non-null input to wrap.
        includes - An non-null array with unique indices of columns to have in this input.

      • FilterColumnRowInput

        public FilterColumnRowInput(RowInput input,
                            String... includes)
        New input only containing the columns as per array argument.
        Parameters:
        input - The non-null input to wrap.
        includes - An non-null array with unique names of columns to have in this input.

    • Method Detail

      • getDataTableSpec

        public DataTableSpec getDataTableSpec()
        The table spec of the input.
        Specified by:
        getDataTableSpec in class RowInput
        Returns:
        The table spec of the input table/stream.

      • poll

        public DataRow poll()
             throws InterruptedException
        Get the next row from the input stream. The call may block if upstream nodes are still in the process of generating data. Client code could look like this: 
         DataRow row;
 while ((row = rowInput.poll()) != null) {
     // do something with row
 }
 rowInput.close();
        Specified by:
        poll in class RowInput
        Returns:
        The next row or null if the end of the stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If canceled.

      • close

        public void close()
        Indicates that no more input is needed. Upstream nodes may stop generating data (unless there are other consumers).
        Specified by:
        close in class RowInput
